channel.title: Teleport command
channel.description:
Ok i know how to place a portal but now i want to learn how to make it able to teleport me to an area.
I know im supposed to put down like.
Case 4188: teletoX=#### teletoY=#### I know its something like that.
Is there any problems im missing.
I'm a beginner coder and wanting to code my server.
Thanks

item.title: Teleport command
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Dragon-History is based on Delta, I believe. Replace the ‘teletoX’ with ‘toX’ and ‘teletoY’ with ‘toY’.

Read full topic

item.title: Teleport command
item.dc:creator: @Stabios11 Stabios11
item.description:
@Stabios11 wrote:

jc22493:

If you’re using Delta, it should be toX = ####; and toY = ####;.

I’m using Dragon-History Source
Would Delta work better?

Read full topic

item.title: Teleport command
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

If you’re using Delta, it should be toX = ####; and toY = ####;.

Read full topic

item.title: Teleport command
item.dc:creator: @Stabios11 Stabios11
item.description:
@Stabios11 wrote:

jc22493:

Change the ‘teleto’ to ‘teleportTo’.

same thing i guess i might have it in the wrong postion

Read full topic

item.title: Teleport command
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Change the ‘teleto’ to ‘teleportTo’.

item.title: Teleport command
item.dc:creator: @Stabios11 Stabios11
item.description:
@Stabios11 wrote:

[quote=“The Soul, post:18, topic:271336”][quote author=Stabios11 link=topic=358073.msg2734627#msg2734627 date=1238973889]

The Soul said client class, not client.class. Your client class is your client.java. The reason you compile is to convert the information from the client.java into bytecode for the interpreter to read.

ok i have the spot where case 132 is now do i just put down the code?
[/quote]

As Slave Scyth stated, put it under the ‘objectId’ switch statement.[/quote]
Ok i did that now when i compile it it gives me 2 errors.

They are teletoX:####
/\

teletoY:####
/\

Is there something wrong with the t in tele?

Read full topic

item.title: Teleport command
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“Stabios11, post:17, topic:271336”][quote author=jc22493 link=topic=358073.msg2734624#msg2734624 date=1238973761]
The Soul said client class, not client.class. Your client class is your client.java. The reason you compile is to convert the information from the client.java into bytecode for the interpreter to read.
[/quote]
ok i have the spot where case 132 is now do i just put down the code?[/quote]

As Slave Scyth stated, put it under the ‘objectId’ switch statement.

Read full topic

Is there a program i need to use?[/quote]Not client.class, the Client CLASS. Meaning, Client.java

item.dc:creator: @Stabios11 Stabios11
item.description:

And what do i search?

I know its werid you posted a lot of stuff.

Please just help.

item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493

item.title: Teleport command
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“Stabios11, post:8, topic:271336”][quote author=Slave Scyth link=topic=358073.msg2734513#msg2734513 date=1238969468]

case ####: //portal ID teleportToX = ####; //X coordinate teleportToY = ####; //Y coordinate break; //ends the case
[/quote]Also, make sure you put that ^^ under the correct switch statement. objectId, I believe.

Where do i place the code???[/quote]

[quote=“The Soul, post:3, topic:271336”][quote author=jc22493 link=topic=358073.msg2734488#msg2734488 date=1238968540]

case ####: //portal ID teleportToX = ####; //X coordinate teleportToY = ####; //Y coordinate break; //ends the case
[/quote]

Place that in packet 132, the Object Click One packet.[/quote]

[quote=“Slave Scyth, post:4, topic:271336”][quote author=jc22493 link=topic=358073.msg2734488#msg2734488 date=1238968540]

case ####: //portal ID teleportToX = ####; //X coordinate teleportToY = ####; //Y coordinate break; //ends the case
[/quote]Also, make sure you put that ^^ under the correct switch statement. objectId, I believe.[/quote]

Read full topic
